meanings.definition: A person or thing that shoves.
meanings.sent1: The strong shover pushed the heavy box across the room.
meanings.sent2: The shover at the concert helped people move closer to the stage.
meanings.sent3: The little shover toy on the desk kept accidentally pushing things off.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the player acted as a shover, clearing obstacles out of the way.
meanings.sent5: The shover in the factory worked tirelessly to move crates from one place to another.

meanings.definition: To push or thrust with force.
meanings.sent1: She had to shover the door open with all her might.
meanings.sent2: The crowd began to shover forward to catch a glimpse of the celebrity.
meanings.sent3: The wind was so strong that it seemed to shover everything in its path.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed seemed to shover all obstacles in his way.
meanings.sent5: The waves shovered the boat towards the shore, making it difficult to steer.

meanings.definition: A tool used for pushing or moving objects.
meanings.sent1: The janitor used a long-handled shover to clean up the spilled rice.
meanings.sent2: The gardener relied on a sturdy shover to dig holes for planting.
meanings.sent3: The comical shover with wheels made cleaning the floor a fun task.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a magical shover, rearranging ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The old shover in the shed had been passed down through generations for its reliability.
